snippet: Emergency crews in the Northeast continued to work Sunday to restore power to the region and to clear highways after a storm dumped more than three feet of snow in some areas.

byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER and JESS BIDGOOD
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Robert Davey, Ann Farmer, N. R. Kleinfield, Dina Kraft, Elizabeth Maker, Eli Rosenberg, Marc Santora, Michael Schwirtz, Katharine Q. Seelye, Ravi Somaiya, Alex Vadukul and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: Emergency crews in the Northeast continued to work Sunday to restore power to the region and to clear highways after a storm dumped more than three feet of snow in some areas.

headline.seo: After Storm, Thousands Remain Stranded in Northeast
headline.main: Anxiety Grows as Thousands Remain Stranded and in the Dark After Storm
headline.print_headline: Anxiety Grows as Thousands Remain Stranded and in the Dark After Storm
